# Question

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

Here is the required function using Julia DataFrames package:

```julia
using DataFrames, Dates

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = Dates.format.(df[:dt], "yyyymm")
    return df
end
``` 
This function takes a dataframe `df` as an argument and adds a new column `ym` to it based on the year and month of dates in `dt`. It uses Julia's built-in Dates.format method to format the DateTime into string of "yyyymm" format. Then, this formatted string is added to `df` as a new column `ym`.

You can use this function like this:
```julia
df = DataFrame(dt=[DateTime("2021-07-31"), DateTime("2022-08-01")])
add_yearmonth(df)
``` 
This will result in a new column `ym` with values "202107", "202208" in the DataFrame `df`.
